content.rendered:
AqualisBraemar recently undertook the third heavy-lift transportation for Northern Offshore and their fourth jack-up rig the ENERGY EDGE.

The rig was towed from the build yard at Shanghai to the anchorage where it was loaded onto the heavy lift vessel INNOVATION WAY. The loadout was conducted with the aid of the six tugs, the two lead tugs being DONG HAI JIU 101 and DONG HAI JIU’, ably assisted by the tugs HAI XIU 121, GANG FU, HU TUO 6 and HU TUO 8. The project management was done by AqualisBraemar Abu Dhabi, with the onsite project management on behalf of Northern Offshore and the MWS loadout being done by AqualisBraemar Shanghai.

“While it is challenging operating in these times of restrictions, it is not impossible, and we do this on a daily business thanks to our wide network. This successful heavy lift is another example of perfect AqualisBraemar interoffice coordination in these very difficult COVID times.” Said Rodger Dickson, Group Managing Director of Offshore.

For further information, please contact:

Investors and financial media

Kim Boman, CFO, AqualisBraemar ASA
Telephone: +47 959 63 91

Other media enquiries

Endre Johansen, Corporate Communications AS
Telephone: +47 41 61 06 05
Email: endre.johansen@corpcom.no

About AqualisBraemar ASA

AqualisBraemar ASA (OSE: Aqua) is a public listed company that, through its subsidiaries and associates, offers adjusting, marine, offshore and renewables consultancy services to the energy, shipping and insurance industries. The group employs specialist engineers, naval architects, master mariners, loss adjusters and technical consultants in 48 offices located across 5 continents in 31 countries. AqualisBraemar ASA operates under three distinct brands globally:

  • AqualisBraemar: a leading adjusting, marine and offshore consultancy to the energy, shipping and insurance industries
  • AqualisBraemar Yacht Services: a specialised marine consultant to the superyacht market
  • OWC: an independent consultancy to the offshore renewables sector

jetpack-related-posts.title: Valiant Driller jack-up completes move from Indonesia to India
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Via Energy Global AqualisBraemar, part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA, has completed the marine warranty services for the dry transportation of the mobile offshore drilling unit Valiant Driller jack-up from Indonesia to India, where it will operate for ONGC. jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar enters Aberdeen
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 1 June 2015 – International marine and offshore engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar bucks the oil market trend to establish an office in Aberdeen, Scotland. “We know that job cuts currently is a common theme in the oil industry, but we are taking a long-term approach. jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar completes jacket installation
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has completed the jacket installation engineering of an 1800T steel jacket structure offshore Bahrain as part of the Bahrain LNG Import Terminal.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar opens office in Shanghai
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 2 May 2014 - Offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar continues its rapid global expansion plan and opens an office in Shanghai, China. jetpack-related-posts.title: FPSO topside warranty survey job for AqualisBraemar
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 25 February 2016 – Offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar has been contracted by Cantex Global Logistics to provide the marine warranty surveyor (MWS) services for FPSO P67 & P70 topside modules transportation from various Brazilian ports to COOEC’s yard in Qingdao, China.
